intro: Sida dregei, commonly known as the velvetleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and waste areas. Sida dregei is sometimes considered a weed due to its rapid growth and adaptability.
